page.title: 02Farming at Upper Bentley
page.content: Upper Bentley Farm is run by Mr and Mrs Gibbs, their two sons and three {Farming}workers, one a farmer's daughter.They also own two other other farms, a total of 1000 acres. The {Livestock}on the farms consists of over 750 ewes, crossbred Swaledales; 13 rams, Suffolk texels. This spring the ewes gave birth to over 1000 lambs, 1.8 per ewe. At the end of May the sheep were sheared. Worcester{College of Agriculture} use the farm for training students in shearing but the rest are sheared by the family and professional shearers. {Sheep}are dipped twice during Summer by law,with policeman present.Sheep are also dosed against parasites.
